notes.short:
Servo is a small motor with arm that can be pointing at a specific direction.

The `min/max_angle/pulse` may be read-only if the servo is permanently affixed to its Jacdac controller.

packets.name: instance_name
packets.description:
A friendly name that describes the role of this service instance in the device.
It often corresponds to what's printed on the device:
for example, `A` for button A, or `S0` for servo channel 0.
Words like `left` should be avoided because of localization issues (unless they are printed on the device).

packets.name: status_code
packets.description:
Reports the current state or error status of the device. ``code`` is a standardized value from 
the Jacdac status/error codes. ``vendor_code`` is any vendor specific error code describing the device
state. This report is typically not queried, when a device has an error, it will typically
add this report in frame along with the announce packet. If a service implements this register,
it should also support the ``status_code_changed`` event defined below.

packets.name: status_code_changed
packets.description: Notifies that the status code of the service changed.

packets.name: angle
packets.description: Specifies the angle of the arm.

packets.name: enabled
packets.description: Turn the power to the servo on/off.

packets.name: offset
packets.description: Correction applied to the angle to account for the servo arm drift.

packets.name: min_angle
packets.description: Lowest angle that can be set.

packets.name: min_pulse
packets.description: The length of pulse corresponding to lowest angle.

packets.name: max_angle
packets.description: Highest angle that can be set.

packets.name: max_pulse
packets.description: The length of pulse corresponding to highest angle.

packets.name: stall_torque
packets.description: The servo motor will stop rotating when it is trying to move a ``stall_torque`` weight at a radial distance of ``1.0`` cm.
